intro: Maurocenia arguta, commonly known as the Argentine thistle, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are usually spiny and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. The flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
